metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5873 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the __ns_get_path function in fs/nsfs.c in the Linux kernel before 4.11. Due to a race condition when accessing files, a Use After Free condition can occur. This also affects all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel (Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, QRD Android) before security patch level 2018-07-05.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5873` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1017-aws - 4.4.0-1017.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-121.145~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-121-lowlatency - 4.4.0-121.145~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-121-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-121.145~14.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-121-generic - 4.4.0-121.145~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1017.17').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
